body_html:
@jsima Using tf.data.Dataset.range(N).map(...) instead of tf.data.Dataset.from_generator does not alwais work. As I mentioned in #14448, tf.data.Dataset.from_generator wrapps tf.py_func to have a generalized tf.py_func (i.e. allow nested structures as output instead of only flat outputs. Also it assigns the shapes. In #15121 is a PR that extracts the generalized tf.py_func).

On Stack Overflow I gave an example how you can replace tf.data.Dataset.from_generator with something that can be parallized from tensorflow.

Also it assigns the shapes. In #15121 is a PR that extracts the generalized tf.py_func).
On Stack Overflow I gave an example how you can replace tf.data.Dataset.from_generator with something that can be parallized from tensorflow.
body:
@jsima Using `tf.data.Dataset.range(N).map(...)` instead of `tf.data.Dataset.from_generator` does not alwais work. As I mentioned in #14448, `tf.data.Dataset.from_generator` wrapps `tf.py_func` to have a generalized `tf.py_func` (i.e. allow nested structures as output instead of only flat outputs. Also it assigns the shapes. In #15121 is a PR that extracts the generalized `tf.py_func`). 

On Stack Overflow I gave an example how you can replace `tf.data.Dataset.from_generator` with something that can be parallized from tensorflow.
